item.title: annette add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "If you could only sense how important you are to the lives of those you meet; how important you can be to the people you may never even dream of. There is something of yourself that you leave at every meeting with another person." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: annette add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "The thing I remember best about successful people I've met all through the years is their obvious delight in what they're doing and it seems to have very little to do with worldly success. They just love what they're doing, and they love it in front of others." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: annette add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "In times of stress, the best thing we can do for each other is to listen with our ears and our hearts and to be assured that our questions are just as important as our answers." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: annette add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "We need to help people to discover the true meaning of love. Love is generally confused with dependence. Those of us who have grown in true love know that we can love only in proportion to our capacity for independence." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: annette add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "It's not the honors and the prizes and the fancy outsides of life which ultimately nourish our souls. It's the knowing that we can be trusted, that we never have to fear the truth, that the bedrock of our very being is good stuff." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: annette add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "When we treat children's play as seriously as it deserves, we are helping them feel the joy that's to be found in the creative spirit. It's the things we play with and the people who help us play that make a great difference in our lives." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: annette add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "Some men are born mediocre, some men achieve mediocrity, and some men have mediocrity thrust upon them." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: annette add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "[They] agreed that it was neither possible nor necessary to educate people who never questioned anything." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: annette add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "The Texan turned out to be good-natured, generous and likable. In three days no one could stand him." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: annette add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "When people disagreed with him he urged them to be objective." -- Joseph Heller

item.title: annette add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself." -- John Dewey

item.title: annette add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination. " -- John Dewey

item.title: annette add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action." -- John Dewey

item.title: annette add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "Were all instructors to realize that the quality of mental process, not the production of correct answers, is the measure of educative growth something hardly less than a revolution in teaching would be worked." -- John Dewey

item.title: annette add a quote by john dewey
item.description: "Art is the most effective mode of communications that exists." -- john dewey

item.title: annette add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "We always live at the time we live and not at some other time, and only by extracting at each present time the full meaning of each present experience are we prepared for doing the same thing in the future." -- John Dewey

item.title: annette add a quote by John Dewey
item.description: "a problem well put is half solved." -- John Dewey

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Fiction’s about what it is to be a fucking human being." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "What passes for hip cynical transcendence of sentiment is really some kind of fear of being really human, since to be really human [...] is probably to be unavoidably sentimental and naïve and goo-prone and generally pathetic." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "What goes on inside is just too fast and huge and all interconnected for words to do more than barely sketch the outlines of at most one tiny little part of it at any given instant." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "You will become way less concerned with what other people think of you when you realize how seldom they do." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "To be, in a word, unborable.... It is the key to modern life. If you are immune to boredom, there is literally nothing you cannot accomplish" -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "All I'm saying is that it's shortsighted to blame TV. It's simply another symptom. TV didn't invent our aesthetic childishness here any more than the Manhattan Project invented aggression." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Everything I’ve ever let go of has claw marks on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: annette add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Learning how to think" really means learning how to exercise some control over how and what you think. It means being conscious and aware enough to choose what you pay attention to and to choose how you construct meaning from experience. Because if you cannot or will not exercise this kind of choice in adult life, you will be totally hosed." -- David Foster Wallace
